author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...BARRY HAS MADE LANDFALL AS A TROPICAL DEPRESSION ON THE EAST COAST OF MEXICO... ...HEAVY RAINS LIKELY TO CONTINUE OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS...
summary: ...BARRY HAS MADE LANDFALL AS A TROPICAL DEPRESSION ON THE EAST COAST OF MEXICO... ...HEAVY RAINS LIKELY TO CONTINUE OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS... As of 10:00 PM CDT Sun Jun 29 the center of Barry was located near 22.0, -97.8 with movement NW at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...BARRY HAS MADE LANDFALL AS A TROPICAL DEPRESSION ON THE EAST COAST OF MEXICO... ...HEAVY RAINS LIKELY TO CONTINUE OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS... As of 10:00 PM CDT Sun Jun 29 the center of Barry was located near 22.0, -97.8 with movement NW at 9 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 35 mph.

title: Summary for Tropical Depression Barry (AT2/AL022025)
